name: Weekly Book Club
description:
Join us for a weekly discussion about women in robotics and the books we're reading - May's book is Rona Jaffe's 'The Best of Everything' - classic fiction about women, ambition and desire. Surprisingly little has actually changed, although this book was originally written in the MadMen era when smoking and scotch in the workplace were common. Also, Jaffe's prose is like a scalpel.
Next book in mid May will be Machinehood by S. B. Divya.

January's book was Brotopia by Emily Chang, February's book was Invisible Women by Caroline Criado-Perez, followed by Other Minds by Peter Godfrey-Smith and essays by Rebecca Solnit.

Our timezone is California Pacific (standard or daylight) !

name: Career Pathways in Robotics with Women in 6 River Systems
description:
Learn about careers in robotics technology and the skills required to be a good robotics engineer.

Women in Robotics Boston partnered with 6 River Systems to host a panel discussion about career pathways for mechanical engineers, electrical engineers, computer science engineers interested in robotics. Join us to learn more about careers in robotics and the skills you will need to be successful in the robotics industry. The event will include a discussion about the day-to-day lives of industrious women building collaborative, mobile robots driven by cloud-based software.


NOTE: Please RSVP on Eventbrite to confirm your participation and submit your questions in advance of the discussion.
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/career-pathways-in-robotics-with-women-in-6-river-systems-registration-151837878181


Â We look forward to your participation!


Meet our panelists:
  • Gillian Hawkes, VP, Product & Analytics
  • Jess Podoloff, Program Manager, Deployment
  • Diarra Bell, Reliability Support Engineer
  • Katie Boria, Sr. Software Engineer in Test
  • Katie Powers, Software Engineering Manager
  • Savini Prematilleke, Software Engineer
  • Taliza Sanchez, Mechanical Engineer
